cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 miles ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the south-central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Texas coast near Port O'Connor / Corpus Christi

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Most of the Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island; swells also affecting the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible (sustained 25-35 mph) as outer bands brush the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible (1–2 ft) around Sabine Pass and the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could deliver 3–5 inches with isolated higher totals, creating a flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts, periods of reduced visibility for vessel traffic
